title: If is the support role is so terrible that no one will ever willingly queue for it
body: Why don't you just make the role more enjoyable instead of trying to trick people into playing it?

replies.body:
I main support and for me it's fun as it is :I
but it dissapoints me to see someone say: "ugh, i hate supporting " after getting it

> [{quoted}](name=AgeOfTheMage,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Inxvuh2c,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-11-24T00:27:37.828+0000)
>
> I main support and for me it's fun as it is :I
> but it dissapoints me to see someone say: "ugh, i hate supporting " after getting it

^^ This.
yeah, As much as I Love playing support  and as much as i want to take support for them, I need to take breaks from supporting from time to time
I just hate bot lane. It's not support in of itself, but I fucking _despise_ bot lane.

Really, I dislike support for a single reason: gold starvation.

I play the other lanes, and I really hate being forced to be, in more civilized word, the dog of the ADC. I get to poke them with a spellthiefs, or kill a few minions every minute or so, or I just don't do anything besides focus on the ADC. I'd like supports to feel like they get the same gold as the other players; so they don't have to be locked into low budget builds that only work because they don't really need the items in the first place (thresh has displacements and shields, janna has knockups, slows, shields that boost AD, and an aoe heal that also pushes them back, etc.)

The fact that they're locked into low budgets is the main thing that bothers me. I do like helping people, but there's a point where it starts to bother me.

The only way to make support an appealing option for the people who don't play it is to give them solo lane exp and gold, delete their lane partner, remove wards from the game, and rework all of them to be assassins.

I'm not even saying that to be funny, nearly every single person who hates to play support is just fundamentally opposed to the role and everything it stands for because they're so indoctrinated by the concept of having to solo carry in solo q and not relying on teammates,and would only willingly play the role if it legitimately had as much hard carry potential as mid lane.

Personally,  i think playing support is a fine and enjoyable role as it is right now (and incidentally is  thousands of times better than it was when there was no cap on wards).  There's a bit of room for improvement to be sure (mostly in terms of keeping up in exp) but overall there's no way it'll ever be truly popular without becoming a role that would alienate current support players.

you may be correct, my friend.

Especially on the assassin part.

Remove sightstone, buff trinkets, add consumable slot, add more throughput stats to utility items, add damage prevented stat in post-game.

Also random unhelpful idea: ward killstreaks. Announcer blares out that so and so is a such and such for obliterating 12 wards this life, for example.
Remove sightstone??
As a support main spending 800g for sighstone annoys me a lot, especially when me and my adc are ahead.

As a not support main I regret not buying sightstone every time I skip it because I'm ahead. (On AP champs like Annie or something)
Not having a sightstone holds me back way more than an extra 60AP from a needlessly large rod.

I'm not saying sightstone is unhelpful, we buy it because it is. But many of us do not Like to do so, so if it is removed it is no longer the unfun necessary purchase. and as mentioned, it would be coupled with trinket buffs

The thing is, apart from laning phase I feel like supports do nothing but ward (that's very summed up) and I think that's fine, vision is such a big deal in this game, it gives supports a lot of power, and it's actually one of the things I like about playing support, trinket buffs would mean that's taken away from supports, and honestly I'd never play support ever again (I can actually afford to say this since I mostly play normals/premade and the 3 people I play with the most all prefer support as their main role).

>apart from laning phase I feel like supports do nothing but ward

please do not tunnelvision on that part.

Honestly? screw you.

Warding **shouldn't be only the support's job**. Riot has been trying really hard to push this idea (everyone gets a trinket, free trinket upgrades, etc) and I think this would be **great**. It would finally force bad players to examine their own gameplay instead of the top laner dying to a gank and being like "gg shitty support no wards".

I'd rather everyone who thinks "supports have a lot of power" because "supports do nothing but ward" never play the role again than have my favorite role continuously sidelined to a ward bitch. Riot needs to take steps to make supports more engaging to play, and that means the ADC/Mage/etc are going to have to put their big boy pants on and participate in the vision game, like they've been encouraged to by Riot for like **3 seasons now**, so I don't have to spend the entire second half of the game wandering the map so my team can make **sicksololcsflashyplays** with my vision. I didn't pick the role with the most team utility to place wards, I did it to provide utility for my team.

Honestly I strongly disagree with you. When I play support it's usually me that initiates "plays", if the damage dealers do, alone, they will usually get killed. I need to have my ass covered when I go around to make stuff happen and I wouldn't want to depend on teammates even for that (praying god they will follow you and won't get killed while you are in base is more then enough). No warding teammates would mean you are now completely irrelevant in the game ( I ' m not going to facecheck because they are stupid, sorry). Also the ability to massively secure vision control of an area allows me to set up objective calls by myself, all the team has to do is come to right click where I told them to. Full AP brand thinks Ss is a waste of money? That's a baron for me when we have 2 turrets for us . I feel powerful in that regard, if you strip that away what I have more then the full AP brand when he burns 4 times the damage I can heal?

Rather than enabling people to continue to be shitty players forever (not placing wards or participating in the vision game the way they **will be required to if they ever want to be good at this game**), I'd like to lose a bit of my warding power in return for actually being a real character after 15 minutes.

Like seriously, I've been a support main since **season 1**. What you are saying flies in the face of what support is actually meant to be in this game. In Season 1/2, do you want to know what a "support's" "full item" build was? 2 utility items, mobi boots, 2 stacks of green wards and a stack of pink wards. Because **nobody bought wards, even when you could buy them in the shop**. Mage support? What's that?

This has been endemic to the game and it's because there are not enough support mains who actually want to see the role flourish into something other than "ward bitch that keeps ADC safe". 

Nobody is saying "DON'T GIVE SUPPORTS ANY VISION TOOLS AT ALL", but Sightstone was a cool idea that is now horribly outdated. It's a worse version of something we got for 250g a couple seasons ago. I'd happily never see a Sightstone again if it meant we had a version of wards that didn't require me to **return to base** every 5 minutes as one of the classes with **the most HP and Mana regen available to them in the fucking game**.
what if  sightstone was cheaper for supports?

I have to agree with Tenth Leper. I don't play support often, but when I do I'm either sightstone then full ap or sightstone then full tank. I only enjoy the role when I can grow into a carry myself, since I prefer carry roles. We should either provide more cost effectiveness on the support items (watch out for overtuning and mid laners picking them up) or my preferred suggestion, make a support item like the jungle items. Building out of a $350 gold sight stone and a $350 gold regen item; then offer build paths for ap, tank, and clerics; then offer augments to those for further specialization. Then we can support and still have fun. I know my suggestion is probably flawed from the meta perspective, but it would work on casuals like myself.

i feel like sightstone is a fundamentally flawed item, its more or less necessary for supports but even with the sightstone support items feels more like a pause on the build rather than the start of it.

good idea, but sightstone as baseitem would remove the actives from the basesupport-items. not shure about that.
I think it might be cool if there where more options for the lategame-sightstone like {{item:2045}}

Yeah fuck vision. Who needs that anyway. 
Hell back when we were actually allowed to buy wards i spent more on wards as solo laner than you on your little sightstone.
Noone said fuck vision, so stop putting words in my mouth and kindly go fuck yourself.
I willingly queue for it, and so do many others.  How would you suggest the role be changed so that you, for example, would want to play it?

> [{quoted}](name=Flaherty,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Inxvuh2c,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-11-24T00:27:30.354+0000)
>
> I willingly queue for it, and so do many others.  How would you suggest the role be changed so that you, for example, would want to play it?

The only thing I'd like to see them do is update our growth speed.  It's too easy to fall behind as support even if your lane sustain is going well.  We're already forced to "waste" gold on items that are less useful in fights, so why do we also have to be so gold starved that it's easy to overpower us?

I'll admit, if built right supports can be deadly, but they aren't generally supposed to be, they're supposed to help others be deadly, and prevent others from dying. however late game, when there isn't much of a 2v2 laning phase, that's when some supports tend to fall off

> [{quoted}](name=AgeOfTheMage,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Inxvuh2c,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-11-24T00:35:12.612+0000)
>
> I'll admit, if built right supports can be deadly, but they aren't generally supposed to be, they're supposed to help others be deadly, and prevent others from dying. however late game, when there isn't much of a 2v2 laning phase, that's when some supports tend to fall off

But if a support did his job better than the enemy support, and the adc didn't ruin his efforts, than he should have gotten the adc feed enough so that the adc can carry the support. As I always say:

Support wins the lane, adc wins the game.
So more passive gold generation for supports?
Not necessarily passive.  I mean spellthief's is fine as a concept.  But then again, not all supports can go in and poke.  It might be more related to the champion in question.

If you give specific champions extra gold or experience generation that runs the risk of either forcing them into one lane or making them too strong in a solo lane.  I think it would be better to add the benefits to the items support build rather than the champions themselves
So you don't like supports because they aren't carries?

I only play supports.  I just think their ability to keep up with others is lacking too much.  We already have to divert gold to gold-generating items and wards.  Some supports scale better with less gear.  Some get totally screwed.  And some are so item-dependent that if they aren't keeping up, they offer a lot less to the team than they should.  At least, that's how I generally see it.

That's to say, the question is what can be done to motivate more supports to play.  Well, this might be one thing to look at.  Another might be to look at creating more dangerous types of supports.  As it is, people don't have to think about stuff like charging in for early tower dives and pushes because it only takes a couple seconds to destroy many supports, and that trend doesn't get much better in late game.
Because this game doesn't revolve around TDM but objective control.

What does TDM mean?  Team DeathMatch?  That's all I could find that was relevant on interwebz.  And point still stands:  if you are falling behind due to the nature of your role vs. the rest of your team, and depending on whether you are an early/mid/late-game champ, your ability to have anything to do with objective control is moot in the face of your inability to help do anything about it.

Many supports suffer from this problem from my experience.  My inability to outpush an enemy in my lane due to slow itemization and diverting attention to passive items that only help for over-extends (I am likely not getting due to slow itemization and spending my level 1-6 gold on vision warding) is exactly the problem I am addressing.  If you're pillar humping, vision does you no good because there isn't anything you can do to counter when you can't address the issues in your lane due to the problems my post is trying to address.  

Not ALL supports have this problem.  Zyra sure doesn't.  But many do, ergo my post.

I love support, it's my favorite role.
The only real change I'd make would be to make gold generation items give slightly more gold and also give experience, because supports are always drastically under leveled compared to everyone else and that's not OK. A little extra gold and EXP would do a lot to make supporting a more interesting role to people who don't normally play it.
If there's more trouble from laners building support items, then figure out a way to prevent them from buying them at all. Stop nerfing supports because of what other roles are doing.
Yeah I think the support items should help them out a little more, maybe add passives that grant extra experience if the user is lower level than the other lane partner
Having to get sightstone and a gold item before you can get anything else while also being significantly underleveled kills the class for me.
Its all I play. Im srsly getting sick of this autofill crap when Im intentionally queuing for support as my main and getting thrown into other roles I cant play.

The issue with support isn't it not being enjoyable, support might be the funnest role imo. The issue is the **DEPENDENCY**. I loved playing support more than any other role, but for over a year I switched my main to mid because if the team is bad, the support can't carry them half the time. Why risk having bad teammates as support over mid where you can go 20/0 and carry? The gold gated, typically more utility oriented, supports have to carry by proxy. People wonder why supports start skipping sightstone and getting rabadons, it's because they don't want to be reliant on shitty teammates to win lol. It's by it's very nature the hardest role in the game because you're handicapped and unless you take a killer ({{champion:63}} {{champion:99}} {{champion:143}} {{champion:1}} {{champion:161}} ) and ks everything, you're not going to be able to make up for the shortfalls of your allies. I woulda stuck with thresh and the supports I loved, but I wanted this fking gold icon XD. Riot needs to equalize gold for the supports, but it's a hard thing to do right.

Dominion had the right idea.

There were no wards (improve your situational awareness or die) and everyone got similar levels of gold and XP.  As an added bonus, all classes could take primary objectives equally well, so Marksmen weren't absolutely required for a team comp.  If I could 'support' by roaming around with Eve murdering people and helping my Jungler gank like I did back in early Season 1 I would do that, no problem.

Support mains UNITE!
Give me your POWER!
We shall use our superior warding skills to defeat the enemy!
:D

I would queue support secondary if it actually meant I would get my primary role like 70% of games at least.  The problem with it is the people who actually play it as their second role can't even queue for it as a secondary because then it means they'll never play anything else.  So I just choose to never set it at all unless I plan on playing it.  It's more a problem with their system than anything.

I actually really like to play support, but I main ADC and would like to play that a majority of my games.

because most of the people that dislike it dislike it for the simple fact you don't get the kills on the team


Most just want to b "the guy" in the game, and most games the support can't be "the guy" (or at least visually they aren't to spectators)

most people are just cod kiddies that need to get dem kills

I think if Riot put more effort into showcasing a support's gameplay in post-game it might fix this. More people might feel like "the guy" if there was a "lifesaver" stat that kept track of how many times your shields or healing kept a teammate from dying. Seeing a really high stat for something like that might incentivize supports more (because the support player would be like "holy shit there were 45 times where my healing/shields directly saved someone's life?! I didn't even notice!")

Most people just don't have the game knowledge to recognize when they're destroying the enemy team as a support. It's hard to tell because you're not really making people die faster...

Well but didn't the change of the assist system help a bit in that regard? 
If you are playing soraka and go 0/1/45 and your team overall doesn'T have many deaths you know you did your job well. 
Healing done as a stat is already integrated.

I'm not saying healing done. TBH Healing Done is a trap - it includes everything (self healing, I believe it even includes healing from HP potions?), even "useless" healing.

I'm talking about a stat that keeps track of the number of times a champion would've died without your shield/heal (within x seconds), and show that. 

And you're totally not wrong, but both the mastery system and other players literally don't give a shit about assists (I have ended Janna games 0/0/30 and gotten an A), so I'd really like something that specifically showcases the skill. Tank supports could have a "seconds CC'd" stat or something.

It includes health regen as well.
Nothing funnier than getting more healing done as Braum than the enemy Soraka just because you had {{item:2303}} {{item:3109}} {{item:3065}} {{item:3083}}

you cannot make the role be more "fun" without changing it into something that isn't what it's meant to be. The support role is a gameplay style choice and not many people want to play that style. Most people just care about doing stupid amounts of damage instead of actually SUPPORTING the team. Most people just want to be the center of all attention. How would you change the support role into something that is more "fun" without actually destroying what it is? Riot has done a very good job at making the role more fun overall but if people don't care about that style of gameplay there really isn't much you can do to make new players actually play the role

I really like Support Champions but I can't stand having my success so strongly dependent on what my ADC wants to do. Such a conundrum.

It was my same problem when I tried to main ADC.
I literally que as a support main and only get my role 60% of the time.. so I'm guessing people are queing for support haha.
